profiledesc.creation: Inventory encoded in Oxygen XML editor by Doug Welch. June 2, 2016
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Environmental assessments reports 2000-2011 of various border security installations compiled by government agencies tasked with border security as well as reports from various business and academic institutions regarding social and economic conditions of the US-Mexico border region.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Spanish.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). The user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Arizona Board of Regents for the University of Arizona, its officers, employees, and agents from and against all claims made by any person asserting that he or she is an owner of copyright.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Defenders of Wildlife Records (MS 568). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1947, Defenders of Wildlife is a national organization focused on wildlife conservation. In 2007 the Defenders of Wildlife brought forward a lawsuit to stop construction of a wall on the US-Mexico border due to concern it might damage wildlife habitat.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into four series.

list.item: Series I: Environmental Reports from Government Agencies, 2000-2011
Series II: Reports on Economic and Social Conditions on the Border, 2000-2006
Series III: Legal Brief and Ephemera, 2007-2010
Series IV: CD/ROMs of Environmental Assessments and Border-Related Presentations, 2007-2012

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection (2000-2012) contains materials including environmental assessment reports, books, CD/ROMs and ephemera. Environmental reports are arranged in chronological order to emphasize development over time while published reports (series II) are arranged alphabetically by title. Series IV, the CD/ROMs replicate this organizational structure with government reports in chronological order and all others in alphabetical order.
